Receipt of emails originating from exter.Data: Zeek dns.log, Zeek http.log, Windows Event ID 4688
Receipt of emails originating from exter.Action: Analyze Zeek dns.log, http.log, and Windows Event ID 4688 logs for activity originating from user systems (Endpoints) or servers (Servers) triggered by interaction with incoming emails. Correlate destination domains/IPs and process names against lists of known malicious indicators. Use clustering or anomaly detection on connection patterns to identify unusual traffic volumes or destinations associated with email interaction.

Unusual external-to-internal email traff.Action: Monitor Zeek conn.log for SMTP (port 25/587) connections from external IPs to internal mail servers or clients. Use time series analysis to identify unusual spikes in connection volume or connection attempts targeting specific internal users or groups. Employ statistical methods (e.g., descriptive statistics, outlier detection) on source IPs, connection frequency, and target recipients to identify anomalous email traffic patterns potentially indicative of large-scale campaigns using compromised accounts.
